MIki commands\ ", "+ Since MIki allows inline SAM, I've written a couple of internal commands that might prove useful. Here's a list of which there are, and what they do:", "+ ", "+ \ \
\\\"Changes\\" \-- display a table of changes made to the current web. You can optionally include the \$entries integer argument, specifying the max number of changes you want to see.", "+ \\$[::miki_changes(\$entries:\ [int])]\ \ \
\\", "+ \ \ ", "+ " \}), 1134071293, "zwoc" \})

"\
MIki commands\ \ Since MIki allows inline SAM, I've written a couple of internal commands that might prove useful. Here's a list of which there are, and what they do:\ \ \
\\\"Changes\\"\ -- display a table of changes made to the current web. You can optionally include the \$entries integer argument, specifying the max number of changes you want to see.\ \\\\\\$\[::!miki_changes(\\\\\$entries: \[int\])\]\\ \
Example:\ \ \ \ \$[::miki_changes(\$entries: 5)]\ \ \ \
\ \ \ \ "
